Detailed Description

Client application utility functions.

Because they have to go somewhere...

Author:
R. Pogge, OSU Astronomy Dept. (pogge@astronomy.ohio-state.edu)
Date:
2010 June 21

Function Documentation

void initEnvData ( envdata_t *  envi  ) 

Initialize a MODS instrument environmental sensor data structure.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t data structure
Initializes the enviromental sensor data structure with sensible defaults. This ensures that we have some way to avoid data structures with delinquent information.

void printEnvData ( envdata_t *  envi  ) 

Print the contents of the envData struct.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t data structure
Prints the contents of the envdata_t data structure describing the raw contents of the last TCS query. The Date/Time give when the query occurred.

int getEnvData ( envdata_t *  envi  ) 

Get enviromental sensor data.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t struct
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on errors.
Gets data from the instrument enviromental sensors and loads the results into the enviromental data structure

int initEnvLog ( envdata_t *  envi  ) 

Initialize the environmental data log.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t data structure
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on errors
Opens the environmental data log with the appropriate UTC date tag. Log entries are created by the logEnvData() function.

int logEnvData ( envdata_t *  envi  ) 

Append data to the environmental data log.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t data structure
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on errors
Appends the most recent environmental sensor readings to the current data log. This routine checks the time and rolls over the data log at midnight UTC.

int logMessage ( envdata_t *  envi,
char *  msgStr 
)

Append a message to the environmental data log.

Parameters:
envi pointer to an envdata_t data structure
msgStr string with the message to append
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on errors
Appends a message to the current data log. The message is offset by a # to mark it as a "comment", and tagged with the UTC date/time. This function is used, for example, to note changes in the sampling cadence.

See also:
initEnvLog(), logEnvData()

int fileExists ( char *  fileName  ) 

Test to see if a file exists.

Parameters:
fileName string with the full filename
Returns:
1 if it exists, 0 if not, -1 on errors
Tests to see if a file exists. This is a utility which will let us avoid overwriting a header file in a data log, for example, or messing with a non-regular file.
